channel.title: The Hodljuice Daily Pint
channel.itunes:author: curated by Hodljuice
channel.description: Daily collection of various Bitcoin-related podcasts

item.title: 21 in 21: 21 in 21: Ella Hough
item.itunes:author: 21 in 21
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin education, research on adoption, financial freedom, student activism
item.description: In this episode, Haley Berkoe interviews Ella Hough, who has been actively involved in educating youth about Bitcoin. Hough has developed a research study on Bitcoin adoption across 25 countries, aiming to understand its role in financial empowerment. She shares insights about pursuing Bitcoin as a language and mentions her influential moments that shaped her perspective. The discussion also highlights the benefits of hackathons in enhancing employability for students.

item.title: BTC Sessions: Asking Bitcoin Multi-Millionaire How to Succeed in 2025 | Gary Cardone
item.itunes:author: BTC Sessions
item.itunes:keywords: Wealth building, Bitcoin mining, economic predictions, investment strategies
item.description: Gary Cardone shares his remarkable transformation from a $27,000 salary in the gas industry to becoming a Bitcoin multi-millionaire. He discusses essential strategies for financial success in 2025 and the challenges faced by U.S. Bitcoin miners. Cardone provides practical wealth-building tips, insights into Bitcoin’s stabilizing impact on his life, and predictions about Bitcoin's trajectory. The episode is packed with valuable information for anyone interested in cryptocurrency.

item.title: Bitcoin Optech: Bitcoin Optech: Newsletter #356 Recap
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Optech
item.itunes:keywords: Lightning Network, Bitcoin transactions, coding, technical education
item.description: The episode features a discussion among Mark Erhardt, Mike Schmidt, and guests about the latest Bitcoin Optech Newsletter. They delve into various technical topics like Lightning Network privacy, transaction handling, and recent updates to Bitcoin Core and related projects. Questions from the community are answered, providing insight into the technical workings of Bitcoin. Significant developments are highlighted, offering listeners a comprehensive understanding of current Bitcoin advancements.

item.title: Bitcoin Park: Hash at Home--The Big Insights Small Scale Miners Bring to Market
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Park
item.itunes:keywords: Home mining, industrial mining, open-source technology, sustainability
item.description: This episode discusses the growing trend of home mining in Bitcoin, emphasizing its distinct advantages and challenges. The speakers explore the impact of open-source innovations and the significance of heat reuse in mining practices. They also touch upon the bid ax movement, promoting accessibility in mining technology. Finally, the conversation highlights how collaboration between home miners and larger operations can enhance the ecosystem.

item.title: Bitcoin for Peace: Building a Bitcoin Surfer Kids Community in South Africa
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for Peace
item.itunes:keywords: Community empowerment, Bitcoin as a tool for social change, nonprofit initiatives, personal recovery
item.description: Hermann Vivier's work with Bitcoin Ekasi and The Surfer Kids showcases how Bitcoin is being integrated into youth empowerment initiatives in South Africa. Vivier shares his journey and the organization's transition to a Bitcoin standard for fundraising and salary payments. He reflects on Bitcoin's impact during COVID-19 and its potential for societal transformation. The episode emphasizes personal responsibility and community growth through Bitcoin.

item.title: Citadel Dispatch: CD162: SETH FOR PRIVACY - PAYJOIN, SILENT PAYMENTS, AND CAKE WALLET
item.itunes:author: Citadel Dispatch
item.itunes:keywords: Cryptocurrency privacy, wallet technology, Lightning Network, payment strategies
item.description: Seth, VP of Cake Wallet, discusses critical privacy features of the wallet, including self-custody options on various platforms. He explains Payjoin and silent payments while addressing challenges related to Lightning Network integration. The conversation also delves into custodial wallets and the potential of distributed social media via Nostr, along with the practicality of seedless wallets for users.

item.title: Coin Stories: Saifedean: Is Bitcoin Nearing Cycle Top? Corporate Treasuries, Wealth Concentration & Gold Standard
item.itunes:author: Coin Stories
item.itunes:keywords: Financial economics, Bitcoin cycles, wealth distribution, monetary history
item.description: Economist Saifedean Ammous joins Natalie Brunell to discuss Bitcoin's future and its economic implications. The episode covers his new book, "The Gold Standard," and the changing landscape of corporate Bitcoin treasuries. Ammous shares insights on wealth concentration under fiat currency and the broader institutionalization of Bitcoin. He reflects on his influential work, "The Bitcoin Standard," and its significant impact on the Bitcoin ecosystem.

item.title: Money Matters with Jack Mallers: They’re Saying the Quiet Part Out Loud—Bitcoin Is Inevitable
item.itunes:author: Money Matters with Jack Mallers
item.itunes:keywords: Cryptocurrency adoption, traditional finance, future of finance, Bitcoin inevitability
item.description: Jack Mallers discusses the rising consensus that Bitcoin is becoming an irreversible part of the financial system. The episode explores the evolving perspectives on cryptocurrency risks, benefits, and potential effects on traditional finance. Mallers shares insights into the shifting attitudes towards decentralized finance and highlights upcoming developments in the Bitcoin space. The conversation reflects a growing acceptance of Bitcoin's critical role in the future of finance.

item.title: Pleb Underground: Ross Ulbricht Receives A 300 Bitcoin Donation!
item.itunes:author: Pleb Underground
item.itunes:keywords: Cryptocurrency donations, legal implications, digital currencies, community discussion
item.description: This episode covers the significant news that Ross Ulbricht received a donation of 300 Bitcoin. The hosts discuss the implications of this donation for Ulbricht's case and how it reflects ongoing discussions around cryptocurrency and the law. Personal testimonies from the crypto community provide insights into Bitcoin's evolution as an asset and its broader ramifications on the economy and individuals.

item.title: Robin Seyr: Gold Will Be Obsolete by 2040: Protect Your Wealth & Happiness with Bitcoin
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyr
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin vs gold, financial education, personal growth, monetary systems
item.description: Jesse Berger discusses his trajectory from banking to being an advocate for Bitcoin and its transformative potential. He compares Bitcoin to gold, emphasizing its scarcity and the societal impacts of sound money. The conversation highlights the significance of financial education and personal accountability in understanding and utilizing Bitcoin effectively. Berger argues that Bitcoin's adoption will inevitably reshape our financial future.

item.title: SimplyBitcoin: Bitcoin To $7,000,000!? | Simply Originals
item.itunes:author: SimplyBitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin price predictions, financial empowerment, cryptocurrency education, upcoming events
item.description: The hosts discuss the dramatic possibility of Bitcoin hitting $7,000,000, stressing the importance of education and control over personal finances for Bitcoin users. They promote the upcoming Bitcoin Mining Expo in Dallas, aimed at educating attendees about mining and building community connections in the Bitcoin space. The episode emphasizes the need for expert guidance in navigating the complexities of cryptocurrency.

item.title: SimplyBitcoin: Fed BOMBSHELL CONFIRMS $10M Bitcoin ENDGAME! | EP 1258
item.itunes:author: SimplyBitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Monetary policy, Bitcoin implications, financial strategy, regulatory impacts
item.description: This episode analyzes a pivotal statement from the Federal Reserve Chairman about an impending shift in monetary policy. The hosts discuss how this change could influence Bitcoin and the cryptocurrency landscape, along with insights into various services offered in the Bitcoin ecosystem. The implications of financial policy changes on Bitcoin’s future are thoroughly explored, focusing on potential impacts on investors.

item.title: Supply Shock: Bitcoin, Not Blockchain: Wall Street’s Big Flip
item.itunes:author: Supply Shock
item.itunes:keywords: Institutional investment, Bitcoin strategies, market dynamics, mining practices
item.description: Live from the Bitcoin 2025 conference, Adam Back and Sean Bill from Blockstream discuss the shift in institutional investment towards Bitcoin. They highlight strategies for Bitcoin mining and income funds, including the operations of companies like MicroStrategy. The conversation outlines how institutions manage custody and risk while cautioning against potential pitfalls of debt-fueled Bitcoin strategies.

item.title: The Block Reward Bitcoin For Beginners: 87: James Lavish ON: Tariffs, Treasuries, and the Bitcoin Wild Card
item.itunes:author: The Block Reward Bitcoin For Beginners
item.itunes:keywords: Monetary policy, market forces, institutional investment, Bitcoin strategies
item.description: James Lavish dives into the intersection between monetary policy and Bitcoin's future in this insightful episode. He outlines the impact of a looming trillion-dollar basis trade and the potential actions from the Federal Reserve. Lavish analyzes how firms like BlackRock are accumulating Bitcoin and discusses regulatory changes affecting banking practices. The episode emphasizes liquidity's importance in driving Bitcoin's long-term adoption.

item.title: The Breakdown: Who is Funding These Bitcoin Treasury Companies?
item.itunes:author: The Breakdown
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin funding, market dynamics, corporate strategies, financial sustainability
item.description: This episode examines the rapid growth of Bitcoin treasury companies, focusing on their financial backers and implications. The hosts discuss evolving strategies within firms following the Michael Saylor playbook, providing a critical look at whether this trend indicates sustainability or a new crypto bubble. The discussion reflects on the changing landscape of corporate treasury management in the cryptocurrency space.

item.title: The Canadian Bitcoiners Podcast: Canadians WARNED of MONSTER Grocery Price Increase | The CBP 217 Pt 1
item.itunes:author: The Canadian Bitcoiners Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Economic factors, grocery pricing, consumer awareness, immigration policies
item.description: This episode alerts Canadians to a significant grocery price increase driven by various economic factors. The hosts delve into how immigration policies, tariffs, and rising interest rates contribute to the situation. They emphasize the necessity for consumer vigilance in managing grocery costs amid fluctuating economic indicators. The overarching theme calls for increased awareness of Bitcoin's influence on Canada’s economy.

item.title: The Davani Connection: Davani #256: THE BITCOIN RULES FOR YOUR SURVIVAL BEFORE THE EARTH DISASTER CYCLES
item.itunes:author: The Davani Connection
item.itunes:keywords: Survival planning, Bitcoin limitations, disaster preparedness, resource management
item.description: This episode discusses Bitcoin’s reliance on technology and the importance of preparing for potential global disasters. The host highlights Bitcoin’s value in an economic crisis while stressing the need to diversify resources for survival. The conversation encourages listeners to rethink their investment mindsets and adapt to possible future scenarios to ensure safety during crises.

item.title: The Mining Pod: Cipher Mining’s AI Play w/ Tyler Page and Chris Totin
item.itunes:author: The Mining Pod
item.itunes:keywords: Hybrid mining strategies, artificial intelligence, investment, industry trends
item.description: Tyler Page and Chris Totin from Cipher Mining discuss their strategic pivot to integrate AI and high-performance computing into Bitcoin mining. They detail a recent $50 million investment from SoftBank and the complexities involved in building HPC data centers. The episode also covers challenges related to electricity costs and workforce growth in Texas’ energy sector, alongside insights into the future of mining operations.

item.title: The Pomp Podcast: #1557 Anthony & John Pompliano | Countries Are RUSHING To Buy Bitcoin Now
item.itunes:author: The Pomp Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Government adoption, financial markets, Bitcoin bonds, investment strategies
item.description: John and Anthony Pompliano explore the rapid adoption of Bitcoin by various countries amidst evolving financial landscapes. The episode addresses Bitcoin bonds, hash rates, and the influence of recent US legislation on Bitcoin purchasing strategies. They analyze the stock market dynamics and offer insights into potential investment developments for Bitcoin and stocks for the year ahead.

item.title: What Bitcoin Did: The Debt Spiral, Stagflation & Why Bitcoin Wins w/ James Lavish
item.itunes:author: What Bitcoin Did
item.itunes:keywords: Macro economics, Bitcoin adoption, financial stability, market risks
item.description: James Lavish discusses the precarious state of the U.S. bond market and the structural risks associated with the dollar as the reserve currency. The episode focuses on Bitcoin's potential triumph amid these economic challenges, including institutional adoption and the operational hurdles that ETFs have removed. Lavish examines the macroeconomic landscape leading into 2026, highlighting the risk of stagflation and the potential impact on Bitcoin's price.

item.title: BitBuyBit: P2P Markets Exploding 🤯 | MONERO MONTHLY 06
item.itunes:author: BitBuyBit
item.itunes:keywords: Monero ecosystem, P2P trading, privacy technology, wallet updates
item.description: In this episode of Monero Monthly, hosts Max and Seth discuss the latest developments in the Monero ecosystem, including the launch of GeneralTari after years of development. They highlight a notable increase in P2P trading volumes—doubling to $40 million—and the impressive performance of RetoSwap. Additionally, they introduce updates on Cake Wallet, enhancing features for privacy and subaddress generation. The hosts encourage audience engagement and recognition of digital sovereignty.

item.title: Bitcoin Optech: Bitcoin Optech: Newsletter #355 Recap
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Optech
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin software updates, transaction features, open-source tools, community collaboration
item.description: This episode features a recap of Bitcoin Optech Newsletter #355 with hosts Dave Harding, Alex Myers, and Rodolfo Novak. They examine several enhancements in Bitcoin software, including Cake Wallet's new payjoin support and Sparrow's introduction of pay-to-anchor features. The discussion also covers other releases, transaction batching methods, and the open-sourcing of Bitkey code. The episode emphasizes the importance of continual improvement within the Bitcoin ecosystem.

item.title: Bitcoin Park: Bitcoin Driving Innovation in ERCOT
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Park
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin mining, energy market innovation, load flexibility, regulatory challenges
item.description: This episode discusses how Bitcoin mining catalyzes innovation in the ERCOT energy market by enhancing load flexibility. The panel examines the potential benefits, such as effective demand response to energy consumption. They analyze the evolving relationship between Bitcoin miners and retail energy providers and how small companies drive energy sector innovations in light of regulatory changes.

item.title: Bitcoin for Millennials: Bitcoin Taught Me What 20 Years in Finance Didn’t | Paul Rogers | BFM157
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for Millennials
item.itunes:keywords: Financial wisdom, economic challenges, personal growth, technology and society
item.description: Paul Rogers shares his transformation from a wealth manager to a Bitcoin advocate in this episode. He emphasizes how Bitcoin challenges existing monetary systems and highlights its significance for Millennials. The conversation covers the need for a new paradigm that prioritizes human values over consumerism and explores how technology can enhance life. Practical steps for those feeling constrained in the financial system are also discussed.

item.title: Coin Stories: News Block: Bitcoin 2025 Vegas Recap, Bitcoin Treasury Company Boom, 18 Nations Hold Bitcoin? BitBonds Proposed for NYC, and CLARITY Act Introduced
item.itunes:author: Coin Stories
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin event recap, corporate adoption, national policies, global trends
item.description: In this episode, major Bitcoin news headlines are discussed, highlighting the enthusiasm surrounding Bitcoin 2025 in Las Vegas. Important topics include corporate initiatives like Trump Media's Bitcoin treasury, GameStop's procurement of BTC, and the proposed BitBonds for NYC. The episode also touches on national plans regarding Bitcoin reserves in Pakistan and the introduction of the CLARITY Act by Congress.

item.title: Life with Bitcoin: Can Bitcoin Help You Understand Yourself? | Monika Bravo on Astrology, Consciousness & Self-Love
item.itunes:author: Life with Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Astrology and Bitcoin, self-discovery, emotional connection, personal journeys
item.description: In this episode, Monika Bravo discusses the intersection of Bitcoin, astrology, and self-awareness with the host. They reflect on how astrology can aid personal growth and consider Bitcoin not just as a currency but as a state of consciousness tied to deeper values. The conversation invites listeners to contemplate their own experiences, their relationships, and how they can navigate personal and societal challenges.

item.title: Onramp Media: Flash Forward: From Monetary Asset to Everyday Money
item.itunes:author: Onramp Media
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin protocol, payment solutions, stablecoins, financial integration
item.description: This episode covers insights from a recent conference on the mechanics and future of Bitcoin, discussing its dual role as a store of value and payment method. The hosts delve into the significance of Flash 2.0 for payment systems, the implications of stablecoins on traditional and Bitcoin economies, and various regulatory and privacy challenges facing the industry.

item.title: Robin Seyer: $0.1M to $1M Bitcoin: The Safest & Most Profitable Move in 2025
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyer
item.itunes:keywords: Corporate adoption, Bitcoin mining, investment strategies, energy solutions
item.description: In this episode, Christian Kläger recounts his journey into Bitcoin and its adoption within his family’s business. The conversation touches on Bitcoin's accelerating corporate interest and innovative projects in Finland focused on energy transition. Key discussions involve investment strategies, balancing between mining and purchasing Bitcoin, and understanding public perception challenges.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: $2.3T Bank Sends HUGE Bitcoin Warning To This $300T Market | EP 1257
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Market analysis, institutional perspectives, Bitcoin warnings
item.description: This episode features a discussion on significant insights shared by a major global bank regarding Bitcoin's overlooked importance in affecting a $300 trillion market. Key points include market analysis, the implications of the bank's warning, and critical viewpoints on Bitcoin's role in the financial ecosystem.

item.title: Bitcoin Infinity Show: A New Form of Life | Sovereignty Through Mathematics Chapter 11 | Bitcoin Infinity Academy #12
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Infinity Show
item.itunes:keywords: Sovereignty, mathematics, individual autonomy, Bitcoin philosophy
item.description: This episode delves into Chapter 11 of "Sovereignty Through Mathematics," focusing on concepts of individual sovereignty and their relationship with mathematical frameworks. It explores the implications for personal autonomy in the context of Bitcoin and broader societal structures.

item.title: Bitcoin Matrix: Richard Byworth - Bitcoin Is Taking Over the System
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Matrix
item.itunes:keywords: Institutional investment, Bitcoin strategies, financial concepts
item.description: Richard Byworth discusses his journey from investment banking to becoming a Bitcoin maximalist in this episode. He provides insights into financial instruments such as convertible bonds and shares perspectives on the evolving landscape of Bitcoin as institutions increasingly recognize its potential. Topics include Bitcoin treasury strategies, investment forecasting, and challenges in traditional finance's understanding of Bitcoin.

item.title: The Bugle Weekly: PODCONF Superbowl Aftermath | Bugle Weekly Episode 62
item.itunes:author: The Bugle Weekly
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin news, current trends, community insights
item.description: Hosts Rod and Dick recap the latest important Bitcoin news, delivering insights into recent developments and trends impacting the community. Their analysis covers a broad range of topics relevant to Bitcoin enthusiasts and stakeholders.

item.title: The Peter McCormack Show: #079 - Zia Yusuf - Reform’s Bold Plan to Save the UK
item.itunes:author: The Peter McCormack Show
item.itunes:keywords: Policy reform, digital economy, sound money
item.description: Zia Yusuf, Chairman of Reform UK, shares insights on the party's distinctive policy agenda addressing issues like mass immigration and public services. He advocates for a radical vision for national renewal focusing on smaller government, constitutional reforms, and the potential of digital assets in creating sound monetary policies.

item.title: The What is Money Show: Buy Bitcoin for Your Bloodline w/ Robert Breedlove (WiM589)
item.itunes:author: The What is Money Show
item.itunes:keywords: Nature, financial systems, family planning, Bitcoin's role
item.description: In this episode, the discussion revolves around how Bitcoin reflects deeper truths of nature and serves as an order amidst chaos. They tackle themes like adversity's importance, the physics of decentralization vs. centralization, and Bitcoin's connection to family planning and financial systems among complexity and entropy.

item.title: Ungovernable Misfits: P2P Markets Exploding 🤯 | MONERO MONTHLY 06
item.itunes:author: Ungovernable Misfits
item.itunes:keywords: Monero growth, P2P trading, community support
item.description: This episode recaps the Monero Monthly show, covering explosive growth in P2P markets with substantial trading volumes. The hosts address recent improvements in Monero's ecosystem, including software launches and wallet updates, while encouraging listener engagement and contributions for community development.

item.title: Bitcoin Takeover Podcast: S16 E28: Proof of Work Alliance with Charles Chong, Summer Meng & Spencer Yang
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Takeover Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Proof of Work, Mining Collaboration, Renewable Energy, AI Impact
item.description: This episode features Charles Chong, Spencer Yang, and Summer Meng discussing the Proof of Work Alliance and its vital role in educating and supporting miners. They delve into the challenges faced when launching PoW projects, highlight the need for cooperation among miners, and address environmental concerns tied to Bitcoin mining, especially regarding energy usage and renewable resources. The conversation also touches on the influence of AI on Bitcoin mining and the ongoing debate between centralization and decentralization within mining alliances.

item.title: Live From Bitcoin Beach: Bitcoin Gentrification in El Salvador: The Hypocrisy No One Talks About | Lexi Cross
item.itunes:author: Live From Bitcoin Beach
item.itunes:keywords: Real Estate Investment, Bitcoin in El Salvador, Economic Implications, Relocation
item.description: In this episode, Mike Peterson interviews Lexi Cross about the nuances of the El Salvador real estate market and the economic implications of Bitcoin transactions. They explore various investment opportunities such as turnkey condos and oceanview properties while discussing how Bitcoin purchases affect foreign investments. This episode is a valuable resource for anyone considering moving to El Salvador or purchasing a second home.

item.title: Pleb Underground: DONT FALL FOR THESE BITCOIN SALES STRATEGIES - FUNDAMENTALS NEVER FAIL!
item.itunes:author: Pleb Underground
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin Sales Tactics, Fundamental Principles, Market Trends, Investment Psychology
item.description: The host discusses the psychological tactics utilized by salespeople to influence Bitcoin holders, emphasizing the necessity of adhering to fundamental principles. Ser Ulric highlights examples of how sales strategies are designed to sway opinions and shares insights on the importance of straightforward Bitcoin strategies like stacking sats. The episode offers a reminder to focus on foundational knowledge rather than get caught up in speculative trends.

item.title: Robin Seyer: The Rare 0.001 BTC Asset on Track to Hit $20M by 2044 (Here's Why!)
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyer
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin Adoption, Future Projections, Economic Impacts, Misinformation
item.description: Robin Seyr examines Bitcoin's significant potential as a revolutionary financial system poised to replace traditional currencies. He discusses the increasing adoption of Bitcoin, its potential societal transformations, and the informational challenges that impede understanding of its true benefits. The conversation predicts a rapid approach to mainstream acceptance for Bitcoin, emphasizing that everyone can contribute to its advancement.

item.title: SimplyBitcoin: Billionaire Predicts $23 Million Bitcoin!? | EP 1256
item.itunes:author: SimplyBitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin Price Predictions, Market Speculation, Cryptocurrency Trends
item.description: This episode reveals Michael Saylor's staggering prediction of a $23 million price for Bitcoin announced at Bitcoin 2025 in Las Vegas. The conversation explores the implications of such a forecast for the cryptocurrency market and the excitement surrounding Bitcoin's future value.

item.title: SimplyBitcoin: Money EXPERT Explains How $1M Bitcoin in 673 Days Happens! | EP 1255
item.itunes:author: SimplyBitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Cryptocurrency Valuation, Market Forecasts, Investment Strategies
item.description: Arthur Hayes provides insights suggesting it's "easy" for Bitcoin to reach a million-dollar valuation. This episode breaks down the pathways and market dynamics that could facilitate such a significant price increase within a short timeframe, offering listeners a glimpse into possible future scenarios for Bitcoin investments.

item.title: The Bitcoin Playbook: Jamie Dimon Called Bitcoin a Scam. Now $4T JPMorgan’s Selling It
item.itunes:author: The Bitcoin Playbook
item.itunes:keywords: Institutional Adoption, Bitcoin Acceptance, Financial Strategies
item.description: This episode explores Jamie Dimon's shifting perspective on Bitcoin as JPMorgan begins offering it to clients. The conversation examines Wall Street's evolving stance on Bitcoin, the rise of Bitcoin-centric operations at firms like Ledn, and the increasing prevalence of consumer usage through Lightning payments, framing these developments within the broader institutional landscape.

item.title: The Breakdown: Bitcoin Vegas Goes Big as Politics Takes Center Stage
item.itunes:author: The Breakdown
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin Conference, Political Engagement, Adoption Trends
item.description: This episode recaps a massive Bitcoin Conference in Las Vegas that attracted over 30,000 participants and highlighted political discussions surrounding cryptocurrency's future. Key political figures shared insights on cryptocurrency’s potential role in combating financial tyranny, while various trends such as record-high price predictions and Lightning payments showcased the growing mainstream acceptance of Bitcoin.

item.title: The Mining Pod: Antminer S23, Swan’s Lawsuit, Pakistan 2GW Ambitions, Trump Tariffs and a Cango Update!
item.itunes:author: The Mining Pod
item.itunes:keywords: Mining Technology, Legal Issues, Energy Allocation, Industry Trends
item.description: Recorded at the Bitcoin Conference, this episode covers several important topics including Bitmain's new Antminer S23 with enhanced efficiency, the pause on Swan’s lawsuit, and Pakistan's ambitious 2GW allocation for Bitcoin mining. The hosts also discuss the latest updates on tariffs and mystical donation dramas, emphasizing the rapid growth of conference attendance over the years.

item.title: The Pomp Podcast: #1556 Jordi Visser | Are Bitcoin Bonds the Next Big Investment?
item.itunes:author: The Pomp Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Investment Strategies, Bitcoin Bonds, Market Trends
item.description: Jordi Visser shares his expertise as he discusses the burgeoning interest in Bitcoin bonds and other investment strategies in the cryptocurrency arena. He highlights the reasons behind countries buying Bitcoin and addresses how AI and tariffs will influence investment portfolios. This episode offers valuable insights about current investment trends in the crypto space.

item.title: The Transformation of Value: What Is Freedom Of The Press? With Cody Ellingham
item.itunes:author: The Transformation of Value
item.itunes:keywords: Journalism, Press Freedom, Media Challenges
item.description: Cody Ellingham joins Simon James French to discuss the vital concept of freedom of the press and its implications for society. They explore the challenges faced by media organizations in today's environment, the importance of press freedom in maintaining democracy, and the critical role journalism plays in informing the public. This insightful conversation highlights the need to safeguard press liberties.

item.title: Bitcoin Park: Free Market Mining: Hashing on ERCOT Spot Price versus Fixed PPAs
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Park
item.itunes:keywords: Energy Market Dynamics, Bitcoin Mining Risks, Renewable Energy Integration, Strategic Decision-Making
item.description: This episode explores ERCOT's energy market, emphasizing the impact of Bitcoin mining on load growth. Experts analyze energy strategies across various zones, focusing on operational risks and the integration of renewable sources. Key takeaways highlight the significance of energy pricing strategies, software solutions for risk management, and the importance of flexible loads. The discussion also touches on forward selling of power and the influence of seasonal factors in energy pricing decisions.

item.title: Citadel Dispatch: CD161: ARBEDOUT - SOMETHING MORE PROFOUND
item.itunes:author: Citadel Dispatch
item.itunes:keywords: Collaborative Custody, Network Protocols, Bitcoin Development, Political Economy
item.description: In this episode, Arbedout discusses innovative custody tools and their implications for bitcoin protocols. He provides insights into his collaborative custody solution, Sigbash, and shares themes from his book "Something More Profound." The conversation also evaluates the trajectory of protocol development, particularly Nostr, and analyzes Bitcoin's current state and future potential, including the distinctions between soft and hard forks.

item.title: Onramp Media: Bitcoin 2025: A New Era of Strategic Moves by Nations, Corporations, and Institutions
item.itunes:author: Onramp Media
item.itunes:keywords: Institutional Adoption, Market Sentiment, Bitcoin Risks, Lightning Network
item.description: This episode discusses the implications of Bitcoin highlighted during the Bitcoin 2025 Conference, focusing on its adoption by individuals and institutions. Key topics include market sentiment, GameStop's BTC strategy, and the political landscape surrounding Bitcoin. The hosts also address grassroots adoption efforts, risks associated with custodial services, and the future of Bitcoin as a payment system, especially through the Lightning Network.

item.title: PlebUnderGround: SCAM ALERT! Is Your Trezor Secure?
item.itunes:author: PlebUnderGround
item.itunes:keywords: Cryptocurrency Security, Hardware Wallets, Phishing Risks, Best Practices
item.description: This episode highlights security concerns related to Trezor wallets amid rising scams, emphasizing best practices for ensuring cryptocurrency safety. The hosts discuss vigilance against phishing attacks and the necessity of verifying transactions. The conversation encourages listeners to stay informed and adopt secure measures to protect their investments from potential threats.

item.title: Robin Seyer: Bitcoin: The Energy Currency Inspired by Thomas Edison That Could End Wars!
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyer
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin Mining Economics, Decentralization Challenges, Infrastructure Development, Energy Relationship
item.description: Jacob Scanlan discusses the economics of Bitcoin mining and its relationship with energy dynamics. He emphasizes the importance of mining as an alternative to purchasing Bitcoin while addressing challenges related to decentralization within the sector. The episode explores mining's ability to enhance energy infrastructure and the broader implications of Bitcoin as a deflationary unit of account. Key discussions include historical lessons and the importance of engaging the next generation.

item.title: The Bitcoin Standard Podcast: 275. The Bitcoin Enlightenment with Ricardo Salinas Pliego
item.itunes:author: The Bitcoin Standard Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Philosophical Insights, Economic Impact, Bitcoin Advocacy, Author Discussion
item.description: Mexican billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego discusses his book "The Bitcoin Enlightenment," exploring its philosophical foundations and implications for the economy. Joined by coauthors Pascal Hügli and Daniel Jungen, they examine the themes and insights presented in the book and Salinas Pliego's journey as a Bitcoin advocate. The episode highlights Bitcoin’s transformative potential within economic frameworks.

item.title: The What is Money Show: Jungian Psychology, Addiction, and Money Printing w/ Stephen Diangelo (WiM588)
item.itunes:author: The What is Money Show
item.itunes:keywords: Money Addiction, Psychological Perspectives, Central Banking, Truth and Reality
item.description: Stephen Diangelo explores how money printing acts as a collective addiction, distorting our perception of truth and reality. The discussion contrasts habits and addiction, touches on the central bank's role, and delves into the spiritual consequences of self-deception. It also emphasizes the importance of price signals for human coordination and addresses the need to confront addiction to find deeper answers.

item.title: What Bitcoin Did: ORANGE PILLING WALL STREET W/ Jack Mallers
item.itunes:author: What Bitcoin Did
item.itunes:keywords: Post-WWII Monetary Order, Corporate Bitcoin Strategies, Dollar Reserve Dynamics, Proof-of-Reserves
item.description: Jack Mallers discusses the implications of the post-WWII monetary order and how the globalization of the dollar is becoming a liability. He shares insights into his initiatives at Strike and the strategy for introducing Bitcoin principles to Wall Street. The conversation also includes how major companies are adopting Bitcoin and the potential standardization of proof-of-reserves for corporate treasuries.

item.title: Bitcoin Audible: Read 885 The Great Taking [P4]
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Audible
item.itunes:keywords: Financial system collapse, Wealth transfer, Central bank digital currencies, Unsecured creditors
item.description: This episode explores the claim that the 1933 Bank Holiday was a planned wealth transfer rather than a rescue, setting the stage for today's financial system's collapse. David Rogers Webb argues that the Federal Reserve's structure allowed selected banks to reopen with government losses covered, making cash depositors unsecured creditors. The discussion highlights alarming derivatives figures that surpass the global economy's value and warns of increasing threats to private deposits as central bank digital currencies emerge. Listeners are prompted to consider whether we're witnessing a final financial heist.

item.title: Bitcoin Park: Beating the Texas Heat: What Cooling Solutions Are Best for Our Climate?
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Park
item.itunes:keywords: Cooling technologies, Mining operations, Environmental impact, Facility design
item.description: In this episode, Shaun Dunn discusses innovative cooling technologies for mining operations in Texas amid extreme heat. He examines various methods like air, hydro, and immersion cooling, taking into account the upfront costs versus long-term savings, as well as environmental concerns such as water usage. Key insights include the importance of facility design and fluid selection in maximizing efficiency and reliability. The conversation also touches on the rapid evolution and collaboration within the mining cooling technology sector.

item.title: Bitcoin for Millennials: I Dismissed Bitcoin But THIS Changed My Mind | Tim Sae Koo | BFM156
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for Millennials

item.title: Bitcoin Audible: Read 883 - The Great Taking [P2]
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Audible
item.itunes:keywords: Ownership Illusions, Financial System, Collateralization, Asset Seizures
item.description: David Rogers Webb discusses the illusion of ownership within the financial system, arguing that most tradable financial instruments are collateral pledged to creditors. He examines the legal frameworks that support the ability of creditors to seize assets during crises and raises critical questions about true ownership. The episode highlights the transition from physical asset ownership to a legal system that favors a protected class and suggests that these developments have largely gone unnoticed by the public.

item.itunes:author: Bitcorner with Juan Cienfuegos

item.description: Lawrence Lepard takes a deep dive into the causes of current economic chaos, primarily focusing on the broken monetary system. He notes that a significant portion of the money supply has been printed in recent years, contributing to inflation. The discussion touches on the mathematical traps of sovereign debt, the constraints faced by the Federal Reserve, and the looming potential for a monetary reset. Lepard emphasizes the cycles of failed currencies and shares essential knowledge on navigating the changing economic landscape.
